I love this game. I bought it on a whim look8ng for something to pass the time. But this is a lot more than that. The graphics is very nice and I love the occasional jokes. It gets hard sometimes but you can get hints. One thing, saving the game takes ages sometimes. It's worth every penny.

I highly recommend it, though... Involving, interesting and well designed. Thank you! Now off with n. 2!

I really lime this game and how the player is able to move around to interact with more item as opposed to the first person view most games such as escape games use. that being said I wish the game didn't crash so often which isn't that big of a deal you just have to save often and sometimes make sure you load your save file . if the compass puzzle in cabin from your father's research could be fixed I would give it a 5 star but I am currently stuck and cannot progress any farther , no matter where I put the nuts on the pins when I brass the button nothing happens

As others have said, it would be a very good game if it didn't crash constantly.  Storyline, graphics, controls etc. are great but it crashes every 10 mins or so which is a LOT when you consider the game consists of 10 or so hours of gameplay.  I have no problem paying for a decent game, and while this one has potential, its not worth its price in its current state.  The problem is way too frequent and frustrating.  If you're reading thos and going to try it out anyway, just be sure to save your progress OFTEN!!

UPDATED: I had to update this review and downgrade this game to 1 star. This game has become tedious, rather than enjoyable, because of all the crashes. If the developer is reading this, "You really need to fix the crashes within this game or start issuing refunds. This game is unbearably glitchy and you should be ashamed of yourself for allowing this to continue for so long without fixing the problem."

This is a very good, highly engaging game. I have only played a handful of games through to the end, and this is one of them. The graphics are nice, the storyline is excellent, and it makes you want to keep playing to find out what happens next. There were two errors that I found. First, in the naming of objects (on the rare occasion I used the hint system). The hint system calls objects by very weird names, and often it is not the name used for the object in the game itself, so it was sometimes tricky figuring out what specifically was being referred to. It's a relatively minor issue, but still a bit weird/frustrating at times. The bigger error was in saving - the game almost never saved exactly where I was progress-wise. I usually had to redo several things I had done prior to the last save when resuming the game, which got annoying. That said, this game is absolutely a must-have for anyone who likes casual adventure gaming. The game itself offers pleny of playtime (more than almost any other adventure game I've tried), and when you're done there are some really funny "extras" to watch as well. Definitely worth the money. For me, it's on to the next game in the series!

Having played the game on Nintendo a few years ago I was really impressed with the move to tablet. Very smooth and very few glitches (although at various points it told me exits led to 'the asylum' long after we left that area). Other than that a great length for the money and very enjoyable. I particularly love some of Nina's sarcastic comments.
